summary: Klein is mentioned in three documents related to a visit by Julia Wetzel (NSA) to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) on November 28, 1978. Klein, along with Cornwell, conducted an interview with Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson, USAF, regarding a facility capable of collecting the Lisbon-Tangier link. The report generated from this interview was reviewed by Wetzel, who ensured its classification due to sensitive information. The documents suggest Klein's involvement in gathering information relevant to the HSCA's investigation, specifically concerning communications intelligence.
